head.title: Nursing Homes: We Can Do More

hedline.hl1: Nursing Homes: We Can Do More

abstract.p: American Health Care Assn president Charles H Roadman 2d letter on Sept 25 editorial hails Pres Clinton's call for $1 billion to help nursing homes hire more health care workers; drawing

block.p: You correctly applaud President Clinton's call for $1 billion to help hire more health care workers (editorial, Sept. 25). The skilled nursing community is experiencing the most challenging labor market in memory.

You correctly applaud President Clinton's call for $1 billion to help hire more health care workers (editorial, Sept. 25). The skilled nursing community is experiencing the most challenging labor market in memory.

Several weeks ago, the American Health Care Association called upon Congress and the Clinton administration to join us in an effort to attract more than 250,000 new certified nursing assistants into the profession by 2002. We agree with you that if Congress does indeed try to ''mandate'' staffing ratios, it must also be ready to step up to its financing obligations. We believe that staffing mandates must be fully financed.
All parties agree on the need to increase staffing levels in America's nursing homes. We look forward to working with the president and Congress to make this goal a reality.
CHARLES H. ROADMAN II, M.D. President and Chief Executive American Health Care Association Washington, Sept. 28, 2000
